<caption = ''>The story event "Beaches, Bathing Suits & Blazing Trails" will start on Oct 14 at 22:00 (UTC) !

During the event, you can train Umamusume to obtain Event Points and Prize Coins, which let you unlock story episodes, event-exclusive Support Cards, and more!

Event previews now come with voice lines!
Once the event reward collection period ends, preview voice recordings can be played by going to Story > Extras from the Home screen.</caption>

<caption = 'Event Period'>Available: 22:00 Oct 14 - 21:59 Oct 27 (UTC)</caption>

<caption = 'Important Information'>1. For more information, check the notice posted after the start of the event or the Help button at the top-right of the event page.
2. Event duration and content are subject to change without prior notice.</caption>

When I shift into top gear and start zooming like a hot rod!

Every day? Always sleep well, eat well and... eat well.
...The roads here are like a maze. I get lost sometimes.
I'll visit my hometown, of course... grrrowl... Well, after I eat.

I like to sort oysters by where they were caught. I've always stood up for justice.
When I got the bright idea to cover myself in cement from the neck down, I made my peace with the world.
Well, you came to the right person. Wink. Was that cool, or what?
No comment... Hahaaa! I've always wanted to say that!
Heh, there's one I definitely don't wanna lose to! But it's cool, 'cause I'm gonna crush 'em anyway!
One hundred, of course. I'll show you a flawless race!
I wouldn't be me if I weren't aiming for number one, because I love to be number one. ♪
Not really. The others can act cool or clamor for attention all they want. I couldn't care less.
Never skip breakfast! I had a whole pound of steak this mornin'!

I wouldn't say so. The more you learn about Japanese culture, the more you realize how little you truly know.

Having the guts to give it everything you got and never give up!

Winning with grace, I suppose. But if the race goes down to the wire, appearances matter little.

A high-energy song perfect for the URA Finals. Let me hear you shout! Umapyoi! ♪ Umapyoi! ♪
Our rivalry is what brought us together... And now there's no stopping us! Never looking back!
A song only those who wear the Triple Tiara can sing. A flowery song filled with determination.
The first song sung by Umamusume after their debut. Echo forth! Fanfare!
A refreshing song sung by rising stars in their junior year. The racers' dreams sparkle brilliantly.
Only those who keep their eyes on the prize will reach the NEXT FRONTIER. The crown awaits...
A powerful song for those who power through and win the day. Not even a raging storm will stop them.
As if flowers will bloom from this very tune, this music captures the beautiful moment of a G1 triumph. Chase your dreams, and they will come true!
Whether we're racing or just running for the fun of it, we give the track everything we've got! We gathered up all the unique dreams we have, and put them into this song, so let's go! Starting gate!

Sometimes we fight, and we don't know how to make up. But deep down, we'd rather be smiling together. No matter how blue or bitter we feel, that's just part of being friends—and this song is a reminder of that!
A song where the brightest star can shine, one of bravery and hope. An exciting new feeling... A signal of new beginnings.
A song filled with a fleeting yet strong will. With a wish in her heart, she makes a plea to the moon.
They vowed to be the fastest! The racers, running beyond their limits, follow their instincts and shout!
A song those who wear the Classic Triple Crown can sing. Performing this is every racer's dream.
Watching you encourages me to race on to victory! An energetic song about enjoying every moment!
An intense song about the storm of emotions that captivates racers. It's impossible not to give in.
A refreshing song performed with a rival. Placing your dreams in another, a new story begins...
Now that I know I never was alone... A song that celebrates the smiles and tears born of friendship.

Increase velocity continuously when pressured by another runner and running out of energy toward the front on the final corner or later.

Increase velocity for a moderate duration when in the front part of the pack with 400m remaining. If at least 7 skills have been activated, greatly increase velocity for a moderate duration instead.
Increase velocity with a blazing spirit when pressured by another runner in the front part of the pack on the final corner or later.
Increase velocity when starting to make a move from a position toward the front mid-race.
If positioned toward the front on a straight late-race, increase velocity with high spirits. If the straight is on the backstretch, also increase acceleration very slightly.
If well-positioned late-race on the final corner or later, increase velocity. If there's a large distance left to the finish, also increase acceleration very slightly with perfect form.
Increase velocity by deriving a path to victory mid-race after staying well-positioned from the start of the race up until the second half.
Increase velocity when passing another runner toward the front on the final corner. If passing toward the back, increase acceleration instead.

Increase ability to break out of the pack when engaged in a challenge in midpack on the final corner.
Increase ability to break out of the pack when well-positioned and close to the runner ahead on the final straight.
Give max effort when far from the lead on the final corner, moderately increasing velocity steadily for a duration proportional to distance from the lead.
Increase velocity with a surge of great fortune when pressured by another runner toward the back in the second half of the race.
If positioned midpack on a downhill just before late-race and there's a large distance left to the finish, enjoy the race to the fullest, increasing velocity.

If the skill user passes another runner on the final corner or later, increase velocity from the midpack onward on the final straight. If the skill user isn't one of the top favorites, muster resolve to keep steadily increasing velocity.
If the skill user stays toward the very back during the first half of the race without being rushed, unleash fighting spirit to increase acceleration on the final straight.

If the skill user activates another skill on the final corner late-race, take the crowd's cheers to heart and moderately increase velocity. If racing at Nakayama Racecourse, greatly increase velocity instead.

When passing another racer at the front part of the pack on the final corner or later, moderately increase velocity for a moderate duration.
Very slightly control breathing and kick forward toward victory in the second half of the race after recovering endurance with skills at least 3 times.
If positioned toward the front with 200m remaining, slightly increase velocity. Then, if also positioned near the leading Umamusume, move minimally forward.
Moderately recover endurance when overtaken toward the back mid-race.
Slightly increase velocity continuously when pressured by another runner and running out of energy toward the front on the final corner or later.
Slightly increase acceleration when aiming for the front from midpack on the final corner.

Slightly increase velocity for a moderate duration when in the front part of the pack with 400m remaining. If at least 7 skills have been activated, moderately increase velocity for a moderate duration instead.
Slightly increase velocity when pressured by another runner in the front part of the pack on the final corner or later.
Slightly increase velocity when starting to make a move from a position toward the front mid-race.
If positioned toward the front on a straight late-race, slightly increase velocity. If the straight is on the backstretch, also increase acceleration very minimally.
If well-positioned late-race on the final corner or later, slightly increase velocity. If there's a large distance left to the finish, also increase acceleration very minimally.
Slightly increase velocity mid-race after staying well-positioned from the start of the race up until the second half.
Slightly increase velocity when passing another runner toward the front on the final corner. If passing toward the back, slightly increase acceleration instead.
Take a minimal breather and slightly increase velocity when in the front part of the pack and there's another runner coming from behind on a corner mid-race.
Slightly drain endurance from runners ahead when well-positioned and pressured by another runner mid-race.
Slightly increase velocity continuously on the final straight after passing another runner 3 times on the final corner or later.
If positioned toward the front with 350m remaining and there is another Umamusume close behind, break out of the pack slightly more easily.
Very slightly increase ability to break out of the pack when engaged in a challenge in midpack on the final corner.
Very slightly increase ability to break out of the pack when well-positioned and close to the runner ahead on the final straight.
Give max effort when far from the lead on the final corner, very slightly increasing velocity steadily for a duration proportional to distance from the lead.
Slightly increase velocity with a surge of fortune when pressured by another runner toward the back in the second half of the race.
If positioned midpack on a downhill just before late-race and there's a large distance left to the finish, slightly increase velocity.

If the skill user passed another runner on the final corner or later, slightly increase velocity from the midpack onward on the final straight. If the skill user isn't one of the top favorites, keep steadily increasing velocity slightly.
If the skill user stayed toward the very back during the first half of the race without being rushed, slightly increase acceleration on the final straight.
If the skill user activates another skill on the final corner late-race, very slightly increase velocity. If racing at Nakayama Racecourse, moderately increase velocity instead.
Gain +{0}% Carnival Points. This skill will disappear when the event ends.
Increase attributes by +{0}％ in the Racing Carnival. {1}％ chance to also raise runner's mood to Great. This skill will disappear when the event ends.
Greatly decrease the racer's proficiency in starting races. Effects include slow starts and reduced starting acceleration. Removed at the end of the Career playthrough.
Increase proficiency in Medium Turf races. This skill is exclusive to the event.
Increase proficiency in Long Turf races. This skill is exclusive to the event.
Increase proficiency in Mile Turf races. This skill is exclusive to the event.

My name's Special Week! My dream is to be the top Umamusume in all of Japan! I gotta work hard to make my moms proud!
I'm Silence Suzuka. I love to run, and I won't give up my lead to anyone. Uh... that's about it.
Hey hey! It's Tokai Teio! You might wanna keep an eye on me! Because there's gonna be a new undefeated Triple Crown champion in town!
Hiii! Maruzensky here! You came here to see me, right? My running's out of this world! Hehe! Try not to fall in love too hard, okay? ♪
I'm Oguri Cap. I'll do my best to win for the folks back home. Thanks for your support.
Bow down! Gold Ship has arrived! Whether I gotta go through a raging inferno, the most downtrodden turf, or even way out there in outer space, I'm always up for adventure! ☆
Yo! Vodka here! Listen up. My policy is to be the coolest at all times! I don't act all lame. Got that?
Howdy! Taiki Shuttle here! I'm aimin' to put smiles on some faces with some hard runnin'!
My name is Grass Wonder. I was born an Umamusume, so I will take this path as far as I possibly can. Hee hee. ♪
I am Mejiro McQueen. I shall surely fulfill my family's ambition to claim the Tenno Sho crown.
A mighty crimson bird swoops onto the track! It's the one, the only! El Condor Pasaaa, the strongest Umamusume in the wooorld!
Muahahaha! Feast your eyes upon your beautiful and powerful Overlord, T.M. Opera O! My legend... begins now!
I am Symboli Rudolf. I hold the honor of being the "Emperor" who seeks to help all Umamusume reach their true potential. Together, let us forge a path to honor and glory!
Hello. I'm Seiun Sky. I'm just taking things as they come. Good things come to those who wait, you know?
I'm Rice Shower... To be honest, all I ever do is cause bad things to happen, and... I'm really just no good... B-but I'm trying to be better!
Hey, hey! My dream's always been to become a Derby Champion! OH, RIGHT! MY NAME! I'm Winning Ticket! Keep your eyes on me!
The name's Gold City. You better not think I'm just another pretty face. I'll let my running do my talking for me.
Hello! I'm Sakura Bakushin O! As you can tell, I'm the model class representative AND Umamusume! BAKUSHIIIN!
Hehe. ♪ I'm Super Creek. I'll work hard to make everyone around me smile. Just leave it to me. ♪
I'm Haru Urara! I like carrots! Oh, and running\ntoo! ♪ I'm always working my hardest to take first place!
Hello. I'm Tazuna Hayakawa, the Tracen Academy director's secretary. I'm here to ensure that everyone has the best on-campus experience possible. ♪
Hello. I'm Aoi Kiryuin, a new trainer here at Tracen Academy. I'm still learning as I go, but I'll do my absolute best!
Hello! Daiwa Scarlet here! I'll try my best to... What am I saying? "Trying" won't cut it. I will be number one!
I see a buncha Umamusume here looking like they wanna take me on!\nWell, Hishiama will give you all you can handle!\nCome at me! One-on-one!
I am Air Groove. If you are unwavering in your beliefs, your ideals will blossom. It is my role as Empress to lead by example.
Hi hi! I'm Digitan! I'm here to support all these sparkling Umamusume! Every day here is a good day! Especially for an Uma Otaku!
I'm Tamamo Cross! I'm gonna race my butt off and make a name for myself! I may not look like much, but ya don't wanna mess with me!
Pleased to meet you. I'm Fine Motion.\nI'm looking forward to making lots of memories here.\nDo you happen to know any good local ramen shops?
I'm Biwa Hayahide. My goal is to devise the perfect winning equation... I'd also like to point out that my head is of completely average size!
I'm Maya, heh heh! ☆ I love all things exciting! The thrill of adrenaline's the best! ♪ Nice to meet ya!
I'm Manhattan Cafe. I have... a friend I want to catch up with... She's always running ahead of me... You see, right there...
My name is Mihono Bourbon. My objective is to win the Triple Crown. Please refer to my specs for information regarding my capabilities.
Sup! Mejiro Ryan here! I'm real big into fitness and lifting. It's all 'bout keeping yourself swole! See you at the gym!
My name's, uh, Yukino Bijin! My dream's to run in the Twinkly Series and shine like a real city girl! Whew... I think I managed t' say it all without mess'n up...
Hello-lo! I'm Ines Fujin! I'm here to work hard and race harder to make my family proud!
I'm Agnes Tachyon. You wouldn't be interested in finding out just how fast an Umamusume can run, would you? I just so happen to be looking for a guinea pig...
The name's Air Shakur. The data always tells the true story, and I've got my simulations on point. Hope everyone's ready to get crushed by my logic.
My name is Eishin Flash. I run to preserve Umamusume tradition. I always run right on schedule.
My name's Smart Falcon, but you can call me Falco! My dream is to become an Umadol! Just let me know if you want my autograph! ☆
The name's Narita Taishin.\nI'm in this to make all the people who doubted me look stupid.\nNow leave me alone.
Hello. My name is Nishino Flower. My dream is to become the kind of Umamusume that everyone can depend on!
Never fear! Biko Pegasus, defender of justice, is here! I leave my enemies in the dust with my blazing speed! I'm the true people's champion, putting a smile on every person's face!
Hey, hey! It's Marvelous Sunday! I hope you'll join me on my mission to make the world just a little more marvelous wherever I go!
Greetings! They call me Matikanefukukitaru! My unwavering faith in the great Shiraoki will bring abundant blessings into our lives. Available for divination day and night!
Hi! I-I'm Meisho Doto. I, uh... I... I hope someday I can have the confidence to... Uh... I e-endeavor to... Oh, d-dang, I keep tripping up...
Yes, hello. I'm Mejiro Dober. I... plan to race in a way worthy of the Mejiro name.
Hey. I'm Nice Nature. Haha, truth is, I don't really live up to people's expectations of me, but... that's cool too, you know? I prefer to take it easy.
Ohoho! My name is King Halo. As a first-rate competitor, you can naturally expect great things from me. Rest assured, King Halo will be a household name soon enough.
It's everyone's favorite jet-black entertainer, Fuji Kiseki! I'm a modern miracle! I put smiles on faces wherever I go, you know? ♪
Sweep Tosho is just an alias! My true identity is Magical Girl Sweepy! Don't make me cast a spell on you! Hey! Thunk!
Twin Turbo here about to take first place! Let's go! Turbo booost!
Wahey! Daitaku Helios in the hooouse! My running will have you vibing in no time! Now let me hear you shout! ☆
Well met. I am Ikuno Dictus. Allow me to meet all of your management needs with my iron will.
I'm Mejiro Palmer! How ya doing? I'm always around if you need me, so don't be shy! ♪
I'm Kitasan Black. I always do my best to create a festive atmosphere that everyone can enjoy when I race!
My name is Satono Diamond. There's no such thing as fate. I intend to race my way into a bright shining future of my own making!
Hi, hi, Matikanetannhauser here. I need to train as hard as I can to make sure I don't lose... Huh? Wait, there's no training today?!
I am Yaeno Muteki. As a student of the Kongo Yaegaki style, I am always in search of honorable opponents with whom to race. Let us fight fair and square!
My name is Zenno Rob Roy. It's a little embarrassing, but I love fantasy novels, and... well, someday I hope to write my own legend through racing!
I'm Riko Kashimoto. It is the role of a trainer to look after the health of their Umamusume. Therefore, it's appropriate to have some level of anxiety regarding one's work.
Hohoho! Seeking the Pearl here! You know the world's your oyster, don't you? I'm here to prove it!
I-I'm Sakura Chiyono O! My dream is to stand on the same stage as my hero! And I will make my dreams blossom!
Ohoho! I am Kawakami Princess. That's right! A princess among princesses. I'm here to smash my opponents into the dirt. Gracefully, of course!
Buono, buono! ♪ Hishi Akebono here! ☆ Whether it's cooking or racing, I put a little bit of love into everything I do!
Hey, sup! I'm Bamboo Memory. I'm just as tough running the race track as I am running the disciplinary committee, so watch out!
Grawr! I'm Shinko Windy! Did I scare ya? Aw, come on! Admit it! Hey! I'm talking to you! Chomp!
The name's Nakayama Festa, and I ain't here for any half-assed races. I like 'em risky—thrilling!

And now, her pen is silently racing across the paper as though pursuing her mother. I don't want to interrupt her fervent efforts, so I leave quietly.

What follows is the monologue of a certain research-loving Umamusume.

"It's what I've longed for.
All my synapses are firing."

An empty classroom on the third floor.
Dimly lit, a thick curtain separates the room from the outside world.
It is a laboratory, so to speak.

She seeks what lies ahead—what exists beyond the event horizon.

"Let's see how well this new formula does as a source of fuel for my guinea pigs..."

Never tiring, she won't stop until her deep curiosity is satisfied.

BEEP— Her alarm beeps once before she silences it. From the angle of the light shining onto her, she surmises that the weather forecast was accurate. "Yawn... Time to wake up. It will take 216 seconds to fix my hair, and 310 seconds to change into my uniform." "Mmm... You want an encore? You got it..." She looks over at her roommate. Seeing that happy sleeping face makes her smile a little. She overspends 5.2 seconds looking at it. However, this is an acceptable margin. "This is why I told you to stretch first!"

Despite her words, she sits up.
It seems like it'll be a while before she can enter the pool.

"There's no better hideout than a pool at lunchtime.

She pretends not to notice her wrinkled fingertips.
But the water running down her forehead gives away how hard she's been at it.

First-rate results aren't built in a day.
First-rate means to be quick on the uptake.
The first-rate heart always aims for first place.

"Truly magnificent! Not only is your training first-rate, but your way of thinking is too!"

"Ohohoho! If you want to be like me someday, then you need to add these three first-rate mantras to your daily routine!"

"Okay! I'll add first-rate to first-rate to first-rate and become third-rate!"

"That's it—wait, no!"

"Hey there!" One day, I'm on the training track when I see a fellow trainer and call out to her. Her cheeks are slightly flushed. "I saw you training! Your coaching was so amazing. It left me inspired. ...I won't lose to you." "Yeah, me neither. Hmph." "Meek! Ah... you're right. I should clarify. We won't lose to you. I'll give this rivalry my all, so you should too!" Her proclamation rings out as clear as the blue sky, and her eyes sparkle like the sun filtering through the leaves in spring.

The satisfying sounds of tapping reverberate around the poolside.
Standing in front of a whiteboard and instructing the two Umamusume is Ikuno Dictus.

"Do you get it now, Turbo? It is beyond reckless to get into the pool without first doing some warm-up stretches.
No matter how physically gifted you may be, if you are not careful, any misstep could prove fatal.
Do I make myself clear? First, do some stretches, and after that—"

"Okay, okay! I get it already!"

"Don't just stand there, Tannhauser, get to stretching!
For your flexing and forward bends, make sure you stay aware of your muscles and follow the directions I've written here.
If you follow this, you should be able to achieve even better results than usua—"

"G-got it!"

Matikanetannhauser, who was previously just watching the exchange, is roped into Ikuno Dictus's lecture.

"You must make sure to take good care of your legs.
Absolutely do not do anything to injure them."

"Leave me alone already..." Twin Turbo almost mutters, but instead obediently follows the advice.
Ikuno Dictus's intentions aren't to lecture all day,
but to look out for her friends. Which is why when she says, 

"On that note, start again from the beginning,"

she's just trying to hammer home the importance of warming up.

"What?!"

This time she's met with protests that echo around the whole pool area. But her stretching class continues on and on all the same.

"Hey! S-stop. I said not to touch my ears or tail!"

"Ahaha, look, it's Nature's extended family! How fun!"

Well, they may be having fun, but not me. Hey, instead of just staring, how about you help me? Don't get me wrong—I like kids. They're cute and oh so innocent. They're completely harmless.
Except...

"Your ears are sooo cute! And so is your tail!"

"Yeah! Suuuuper cute!"

"Ugh..."
Is being completely harmless harmful in itself?
It's not like I care if a child calls me cute or not... I just can't say no when they start looking at me with those hopeful eyes and ask, "Can I pet them?"

"Don't look at me like that. I already told you no..."

But there's no anger in my words.
All right, I get it.
Pushback is futile.
By the end of it, I'll be persuaded by their sweet smiles and... ah, well.

I wonder if Sky is happy with the garland I made. There were many flowers to pick from, but I heard that daisies love the sun...

They wait for the sun to bloom, always facing the sunlight, just like Sky.

That's not the only thing daisies have in common with Sky.

In the language of flowers, daisies mean "simplicity" and "being yourself."

And just like how daisies flutter in the wind, peaceful and free, Sky always seems so at ease, taking naps and going fishing.

Every time we talk, I feel so relaxed. I don't feel like I have to say anything I don't want to.

(I hope she likes the daisies, because I've started to love them.)

I never thought you'd want to read a book like "Ivanhoe." No, believe me, I'm overjoyed.

Wait just a moment. Yes, we have it here in the library...

How about this new paperback edition? It's annotated very well, so you'll have no problem understanding the passages.

I can also recommend this large format version. It has plenty of illustrations, so you can easily picture what life was like in those days.

Oh, there's also a novelization of the movie available as well! It's an original take on the story with a truly thrilling plotline! The spear fight scene between the five Umamusume is just an absolute masterpiece.

However, I really hope you read the original story eventually! The old-fashioned and dignified style of the original text creates an impactful impression of the hero archetype.

The people of Edo passed their fighting spirit down the generations... to youths like the fiery Umamusume here. "I'm Inari One, an Edo Umamusume, born n' raised! A runner gently dabs the sweat from her forehead. Her dignified profile reflects a noble spirit and willpower not deterred by adverse winds.

"Nevertheless, I will run."

Her legs are as delicate as a pane of glass. There are many who worry over the intensity of her running.

"Nevertheless, I will persist."

Her gaze remains fixed upon two silhouettes in the distance. One shines gloriously on the battlefield. The other carries a pale and fleeting desire. As she watches the distant two, a sense of impatience rises.

"Nevertheless, I will compete. I want to run with the pride I now feel in my heart."

And so, she steps forward and will continue to do so for so long as she breathes... no, so long as the path still stretches before her.

From exquisite gourmet masterworks to the homely bowls of a mom-and-pop place, to the cup noodles you can make yourself! Ah, what wonders await me in ramen's myriad representations! She sits confidently, surrounded by her squealing fangirls. It's hard to say whether the cynical smirk on her lips masks ire at the fuss—or a smug satisfaction.

There's something about her that stops you from trying to get closer, but you can't look away.

Is there no one here who can withstand the charismatic draw she has? All who pass are stopped dead in their tracks, gawking.

The growing crowd jostles and blocks my view. I go up on tip-toe, craning my neck for a glimpse, and then...

"What's this? You're looking awfully desperate. Did you hope I'd flash you a smile too?"

I know you said you were just "keeping an eye out" to make sure I don't ditch my classroom cleanup duties, but c'mon... Would it reeeally be such a "disrespect to the other students" if I took a tiny break? Do you reeeeeeeally gotta yell at me for taking one minute to check a notif? ...Huh? Wait, why've you got a broom? ...What do you mean, "let's get this over with"? Since when are you my mom? I'll do it myself in a minute. And besides, I thought you had plans today. Those creams puff you were gushing about all week are gonna sell out again if you don't get moving. ...Huh? But you were going on and on about how excited you were... Ugh, fine.Just you watch—I'll get this classroom spotless in seconds! But if they're sold out when we get there, it's your fault!

Whew, I worked up a good sweat! I'm really feeling it in my hamstrings!

After finishing her training routine, Ryan gulps down a big sip of her drink.

"Come sit in the shade with me. This kind of heat wears down your body, even if you're not running around. It's about time you rehydrated, if you want a sip of my—"

She hurriedly retracts the hand she started offering, fumbling her bottle.

"B-But of course, you wouldn't want something I already put my mouth on. Haha... silly me! I'll, uh, I'll just zip over to the locker room and get you a new one!"

I catch a glimpse of her face going red, and then she turns and takes off at full speed.

"Wow..."

She sits alone in an empty classroom, reviewing race footage. Enraptured by the blindingly confident strides on screen, she unconsciously gives voice to her thoughts.

"Even if this is what I'm up against... I have to shine brighter."

But before she can contemplate further, her thoughts are interrupted by the door being boldly thrown open.

"Why, if it's not the lovely Admire Vega! Fancy meeting you here—nay, it must be the hand of fate... the will of destiny that draws us together!"

Upon recognizing the voice of the intruder, Admire Vega quietly closes her laptop.

"I hope I haven't kept you waiting, my dear rival! But be assured, I'll not delay our passionate duet another second!"

"...I wasn't 'waiting' for you, and we're rivals on the track, not the stage."

Even as she speaks, she slips her laptop into her bag and starts to make for the door.

"Such a difficult expression clouds your fair countenance! Let us tackle your worries together! Ahhh, I can see it play out in my mind's eye—and what a tender, heartwarming scene it is!"

"..."

Despite her rival's supplication, Admire Vega holds her tongue. For if T.M. Opera O were to know whose race she'd been watching... her peace and quiet would be as good as gone.

In front of a large machine dances a single girl. Her cheerful voice rings throughout the room, and her tail sways in rhythm with her nimble dance steps. I find myself lost in her bright smile—

"Hey! Cheer me on too, okay?"

I feel my heart jump out of my chest. In the next instant, I realize that both her wink and words just now were directed at me.

"And to finish it off, a turn... and a V for victory! Yay, a new high score!"

The machine displays an unbelievably impressive score, and the crowd goes wild. I clap along as well.

"Thanks for cheering me on, everyone! ...Whoa, it's already this late? Let's all meet at the racetrack next time, okay? The mighty Teio will give you a show you won't forget! And with that, I'll take my leave!"

True to her word, the girl abruptly runs out the door. Yet even long after she's gone, the image of her smile is still etched into my mind.

That was probably the moment I became a fan of this little emperor—Tokai Teio.

"Um... are you planning to eat all of that?"

In response to the cameraman's question, Oguri Cap nods with a straight face. However, the fact that her tail is swaying back and forth doesn't escape the eyes of the reporter. At Oguri's level of competition, she must have to train long hours every day, so the reporter asks if this is her way of recharging herself after a long day's work.

Oguri Cap: "No, I just want to eat, that's all. I love eating. Food, eating, and filling up my stomach... I love it all."

Still staring at the food, Oguri Cap's pupils light up like comets glittering in the night sky.

Oguri: "Mind if I begin? Oh, and feel free to try some too. Well then... don't mind if I do!"

With a smile like a flower in full bloom, she digs into the food, and with that, the cameraman is able to catch a rare glimpse of the cool racer's private life.

(Excerpt from Twinkle Monthly, Cover Feature! Oguri Cap—a Peek into the Life of a Racing Idol.)

...I don't want to be known as just some dress-up doll. I want to prove that I can work on something besides my looks.

"Yikes, I burned it again."

There's still so much more I can learn. Like, how to take care of myself, for starters. One day, I won't be just another pretty sight—I'll be the whole package.

"...Right, let's try that again!"

"H-h-hey everybody. Th-thanks for coming out to s-shee us!"

Charmed by the nervous Umamusume's earnest attempt at a greeting, laughter breaks out among the crowd.

"Th-there are so many people!"

"Spe, calm down."

"Yeah, we'll be fine! Just do what we did in practice."

Perhaps calmed by their words, she takes a deep breath and looks out.

"A-as thanks for all your support, I'm going to give today's concert my best!"

Her words are met with cheers. With a smile across her face, she begins the winning concert.

"I was actually... kind of scared. I didn't know what I was supposed to convey to you all."

The venue is completely silent. They sit enraptured, hanging onto every word of the girl standing at center stage.

"I just... love to run. Nothing else interests me."

She hesitates, formulating her next statement.

"But right now, I just want to sing you a song. If I can get through this hurdle, I think I can understand why my heart is pounding so much..."

The song starts to play. She takes a deep breath and reaches out her hand. The answer she seeks is just around the corner.

"Hi, hi! I know we're in the middle of a song, but let's all show some love to the wonderful me! ♪"

Tokai Teio stands at the edge of the stage working up the crowd. She takes a few light steps back to the center and begins the rehearsed choreography.

"I placed first today, meaning center stage is for me! I'm the best and I always will be! ♪"

With the spotlight making her shine all the more, she raises three fingers to the sky.

"My goal to become the undefeated Triple Crown champion is not just a dream! So get rid of those nasty doubts and root for me all the way! ♪"

The Golshi battleship has no need for fuel. When fancy strikes her, she takes off like the wind, but she is a fickle being. Go LD-Ship I (A poet, a philosopher, and fearless adventurer/????) "Get out of my way! Move, I say! Move!" All of a sudden, in the final stretch, that devilish silver-haired racer we all thought was in dead last charges forward! "Yahoo! Bada-bing-bada-boom!" Shocking and fearless, she blasts past the finish line and winds up in the North Pole. "Whoops! I missed the K-point! Oh, I'm such a klutz! ☆" Tune in next time for Oden! You'd better be watching!

Speaking of which, where is that Umamusume? In that precise moment, she kicks into high gear and faces the last stretch to break the dead heat. "All right! The real race starts here!" "Watch and learn, punks! This is what Vodka can do! And don't you dare forget!" Her engines rev and rev and rev until she finishes first. Legends are those who live up to their coolness.

She bounds out of the starting gate with great power. But perhaps as a result, she sways slightly to the right. (Whoops! But I'm fine!) She kicks back hard and quickly straightens herself. Within moments, her mistake, family, and competitors all disappear from her mind. "Huff... huff... Hahaha!" A gentle breeze? No. A raging storm rushes over the track.

(I knew this would happen. I've calculated just how much stamina I need at this point in the race!)

The unexpected results shock and anger those around her, but Air Shakur is undeterred. She returns their scorn with mocking laughter.

Gold City's golden strands wave in the wind as raindrops slide down her locks. Her breathtaking beauty, apparent even from a distance, is completely obscured by mud. "Just a... little... more!" If she can leave the rest of the runners behind on this last stretch, victory is hers. The rain, the mud, the sweat... They are merely accessories. This is the runway where she shines!

But what if I lose steam before I get there? What if... I can't?

"YOU CAN DO IT! RUN, PALMEEEEER!"

Oh... The heat in my body is rising. I still have the energy. I can keep going! I can keep pushing on! Time to kick into high gear, and go, go, go! It's time to surpass my limits!

blind me even from behind.
I won't let up, not even for a second.

After all, the road before me is just as bright.

We ran with full force and full spirit,

I'm not going to lose again.
I don't want to lose.

She's closing in.

Laughing, crying, and chasing after our dreams.

isn't this so fun, Kita?)

Training is not only important in martial arts, but for all things in life. Running, dancing, singing, etiquette. Without training, they are like the untilled soil—cold and lacking in vitality.

As the night of Halloween approaches, the air is rife with mischief as a lone girl calls upon the witch of legend. The witch surveys her timid visitor curiously, then flashes her a smile—a challenge. "I won't go easy on you, you know." "Yes, I understand that. But I seek your guidance nonetheless... for there is a wish I must grant!" The witch's eyes widen, impressed. She'd half expected the girl to shrink away. With a nod, she holds out her wand. The girl takes it, and raises it to the sky. "My dear friend... This time, I'll be there for you." Her words resound within the witch with such confidence, such warmth... they foretell great heroism in the small girl's heart.

The ghost stands there with her back to me, lost in thought. All this time, she'd been working so hard—ever so hard—to accomplish an important mission all on her own. For you see, the ghost was afraid. She thought the others would be disappointed if she asked for help. That she'd be a failure. But that's not true... "I..." The feelings she'd been holding back start to spill out, word by word, and I think to myself: You know, the reason you worry about the others... is because you're so kind. —Excerpt from The Ghost and the Vampire, a Hand-drawn Halloween Tale

Today's an extra special day! It's like everyone's hearts are wrapped up in ribbons like presents, waiting for someone to open up all the feelings inside! "C'mon, Trainer, over here! You're gonna love the party we put together!" Smiles warm enough to melt away the cold. Laughter that rings out through the silent night! Starlight dapples the stone with every step,
You rush ahead a tile and a half,
Too stubborn... too stubborn to look back yet.

Patchworks of people line the market;
You weave through crowds like the needle tracks
And I'm the thread pulled idly past

Warm glows emanate from rows of stalls,
Stringlit wares, shiny baubles.
Steam rises over hot chocolate cups
Cinnamon scents blend into the dusk—

"What's the hold-up? Don't get separated..."
I realize you've turned my way and waited.

I nod and you avert your gaze
Stubborn again, a tile and a half away,
Not a step further, not a step less 
Keeping me close and distant yet.

Occasionally, you glance back at me
And I pretend I didn't see
I somehow feel, if our eyes meet...
This precious moment will abruptly end
And next I know, you'll be tiles ahead.

On this holy night, walking moonlit streets,
I keep your pace carefully, 
And you lead our way slowly, gently.

I run. And run. And run... But it's not enough to pass the obstacles between us, let alone catch her.

I turn. Again. Again. Around I go... Up... and down. My mind reels—colors blur past—like I'm running atop a giant gear.

And then, I hear someone singing. It's beautiful... but the song isn't meant for me. I think... this whole time, I wasn't looking ahead of me. I was just watching her back.

That's right. All I saw was her. I couldn't see anything else. I wasn't running cleanly—I was running desperately, frantically... just trying not to lose sight of that faint shadow.

There's something stirring in me, diluting the essence of what I was. Transforming me into another gear on the track, chasing her loop after loop.

With each revolution, I lose more of myself. The clamor feels so far away. I can't make out whether the blurred mob shouts in cheer or fury.

As it all melts together into an indiscernible cacophony, one thing alone remains quiet and true—a thin thread—the path cleared in your wake.

(You're still there. And I'm still following!)

The golden disc beneath us whirls. I reach out, stretching my hand to hers—

...And in that moment, I left the world behind.

There's a scenery I see when I close my eyes.

Into the blinding flare of colors pouring over the horizon, figures run away from me toward the light. I'm standing there, watching their shadows, when I hear a distant call...

I can't quite place when or where the episode took place. I've racked my memories to no avail.

And so... It must have been something I saw in a dream. Some sort of nightmare—something dreadful I hoped would never come to pass.

I'm confident in that answer.

...Because when I open my eyes again, I see something completely different.

"Silence Suzuka! Silence Suzuka has done it again! A stunning runaway victory!"

I'm not really interested in daydreaming up what-ifs or letting nightmares cloud my vision.

I want to see new scenery—unimaginable ones—and I want to see it with my own two eyes.

Today. Tomorrow. Every day. Forever!

I have so many goals I haven't reached yet... So many big, grand dreams of who I want to be—of a Doto who stands on top of the world with confidence.

If I could just reach the summit, I'm sure I'd be able to stand up straight and proud. But... I can't reach it, no matter how much I climb.

S-so maybe, I need to try standing a little taller. It's okay if no one notices a difference but me... I'll straighten my back just a bit, and let you give me a push.

And I won't look back, no matter how much I want to. And every time I think those bad thoughts, I'll remind myself to stand up just a little taller. I'll remember the warm hands holding me up.

Without another thought, words well up in me.

"I-I can... I can reach it!"

It's important to have a little courage. That's all it takes to make your first baby steps forward.

Take everything you're feeling and mix it up like cake batter. With a little time and warmth, your love will puff up extra soft and sweet, and then you can give it to someone with a big shiny ribbon!

Use that little bit of courage to perk your chin up and look them in the eyes, then say...

"Will you... accept this?"

My hands may shake a bit, but I do my best to put on a little smile.

Because I want to tell them—I want them to know how I feel!

3,000 long, stamina-draining meters. A long, perilous slope stretching from the third corner. A difficult track that cannot be conquered with effort alone. A stream of sweat drips from her brow, threatening to blur her vision. Her heart beats frantically, like it's screaming for more oxygen to pump through her veins. Each rough breath scratches at her throat like flickers of flame. She asks herself why. Why does she keep running, when it hurts so much? Why does she continue to drag her heavy legs step after arduous step? Her mind doesn't have time to process an answer. But her ears flick unconsciously towards a rumble from the stands. A roar of cheers—of fans' hopes and dreams. She then clenches her teeth, biting down into the pain, and spitting it out. A sense wells in her gut—her fated rival is behind her. The large shadow she casts over the turf is getting closer. Closer. Closer. But she knows she can't look back. She won't give up. The only way to reach the peak is to keep running. ...And that day, the runner who refused to surrender took the crown of the best.

"Huh? Is this thing... Oh no, Bright! Bright, stop! That's enough! ...I'm so sorry. I think the timer's display is messed up." "Huff... Huff... Whew. Now that you mention it, that last set felt oddly long." "Oh gosh... That was probably as long as three sets. A-are you okay?" "Mm-hm, just peachy." "You still have stamina after all that?! You must be really on top of your training! Do you think you still could have kept going if I didn't stop you?" "Ehehe, probably. Honestly, I probably wouldn't have noticed the timer wasn't working if you hadn't said anything." "Ahahaha! That's so like you! I guess some things never change. Hehe... Maybe it's because of how long I've known you, but seeing you crush that set has me all happy." "That's sweet of you to say. It's a good thing I've been training hard to live up to the Mejiro name. I suppose I'll have to keep on improving myself, little by little."

"So, how's it been since you two came to Tracen? Is it different than you expected?"

"Yes... It certainly isn't anything like I imagined. What about you, Kita?"

"Same. It's way different from what I thought."

"Huh? I-in a good way or a bad way? I hope you two aren't disappointed..."

"No, of course not. If anything... It's been far lovelier than I could have dreamed! The training, the races—everything's been so magical!"

"Yeah, me too! With all the exciting stuff going on, it feels like every day's a festival!"

"Whew... That's good to hear. You had me worried for a second. But... I think I was the same way when I first came here too. All this fancy new stuff left 'n right, and special things happening one after another... Tracen's still full of surprises even for me!"

"Really? Even though you've been here so much longer than us?! Ooh, what're we gonna do, Dia?"

"Don't look at me—I'm just as curious as you are!"

"Ahaha, I'm sure there will always be big, wonderful surprises in store for all three of us!"

"Right!"
"Right!"

The stands are roaring with excitement. In the crowd, one man whispers excitedly to himself in a trembling voice. "I've been waiting for this moment... She had high expectations placed on her, but she was never able to take home the gold... Just like me. But now, she's finally won... Because she believed in herself and never gave up." "Was that marvelous enough for everyone? ☆ All of you are looking oh-so marvelous as well! ★☆★" Warm tears run down the man's cheek. He has finally realized the truth that has been lying in front of him the whole time... "I'm... marvelous, too..." And so, another marvelous light is born into this marvelous world.

Your fangs threaten to sink into me with every step. Your graceful movements resemble a predator waiting for the right moment to strike the fatal blow. "I see that you're as sharp as ever. Perhaps you've been keeping up your training? How admirable." "Right, for once. Someone's got to protect our spoiled little Emperor from the eyes of the masses, now don't they? Not like you could do anything without being pampered." "Allow me to correct one of your statements. As I'm unable to resolve this matter expediently, I'll simply march to the beat of your drum for now." It's your turn, and the silence is deafening. I see your scorn replaced by apathy, when suddenly, a light bulb flashes above your head. "If that's how you want to play, then fine by me. But don't forget—you asked for this!" "Oh, such risky footwork! The most important thing between partners, Sirius, is trust. And so you don't forget it anytime soon, it's time for your private lesson." I can see your desire for control in each of your aggressive steps. In response, I will bring all I have and match you at every turn. Do not forget—you stand in the presence of the Emperor, Symboli Rudolf.

...Hey, what do you see from there? Sluggish shadows drifting through the night? Or perhaps dust from the dance floor, kicked up by someone's fancy footwork?

"Mhm, in there you'll only find a tent of tedium, spread around like a sloshy quagmire. They've only two choices—accept their muddy fates and sink, or writhe in vain defiance. How drab."

"However, I can present you with a third choice. Take my hand... and I'll show you how much fun this world can be."

Energy equals mass times the speed of light squared. In the end, everything comes down to equivalent exchange. What goes around, comes around. In other words, no matter how hard you try, you won't get any more than you put in... and that's fine by me.

"This is getting me hyped! It doesn't get better than !monad! Wooooo!"

That said, when needless noise gets mixed into the equation, all of that balance goes straight to chaos! But I won't stop...

"Fine by me. You want more? I'll give you more. I'll overload your senses until you drop!"

I live in a cache full of unknown variables...

"Come on, follow my groove! Ha... haha!"

Why am I trying so hard to suppress my laughter? ...Tch, guess I was the one being played. Well, I've solved the equation, so I'll pay my respects.

"...Until this beat of mine dies down, don't turn on the lights."

I'm a fan of wearing blue and white. It's refreshing, but vibrant. Elegant, but not too pretentious. It's the number one color combo for the me I want to be. "Mhm, just like I thought—this is the number one fit for me! ♪" My outfit's all set. The frills and pleats look good, and I tied the big bow perfectly. A quick posture check... oh, and can't forget the smile! Yup, this is it—this is undoubtedly what an honor student on her day off looks like! "This is an important outing, so I have to make sure to go in my number one outfit! ♪"

You're always cheering somebody on. You encourage them, scold them, and share in their ups and downs.

Even today, you're cheering on someone from the stands up above. Despite waving a banner weighing easily over ten kilograms, you and everyone in the cheer squad continue cheering with your eyes fixed on the race, no matter how raspy your voices get.

You stand in the shadows, where light will never reach.

And yet, you continue exerting every last drop of your strength, all to fulfill your duty. You believe it's simply the right thing to do, and you take great pride in upholding this duty.

"Keep it up."

Suddenly, three words slip out of my mouth. They are spoken softly, quiet enough to be drowned out by even the sounds of everyday life. Words fated to drift away, and reach no other ears.

But then you turn around and face me, still waving your banner, and still cheering the racers on. It's only for an instant, as fleeting as the swaying of a flame in the wind, but I see it—your bright smile shining straight at me.

An exciting race unfolds itself before me as I watch from the stands up high. Every racer is bursting forward with impressive speed. Out of the blue, a strikingly loud voice rings throughout the venue.

"Nice turn! But they're hot on your heels! At this rate... Ah!"

I wonder who she's cheering for. She sounded pretty crushed just now...

"Good job, what a beautiful pass! I can tell you've been working on that! Now take it home—gooo!"

"Huh?! Weren't you cheering for the racer who was in the lead until now?"

The words spill out of my mouth, and the girl, Seeking the Pearl, looks at me with a warm smile.

"In a race, there'll always be a winner and a loser. There's always two sides, like light and darkness. But you know, when it comes to competitors giving it their all, everyone's the same, and I think we should celebrate that! Every racer deserves to be cheered for and praised! I support each and every one out there!"

Her words are pure and innocent, like a pearl. And in the face of her brilliance... I begin to see the world through a new lens.

If I slip up even a little, they'll be hot on my heels. But wait, this sudden ovation of cheers during my most dire moment... This is just like... "Princess Fighter! Don't give up!" I'm in her shoes today, with everyone rooting for me the same way I used to cheer at the TV. "Now, Princess Fighter—punish evil!" She's the definition of a perfect princess, and my idol. "Gooo, Princess Fighter!" There's only one path left for me, for you see, a princess... "Never, ever loses!"

The track was in the worst possible condition. Even so, you treaded through the mud, broke out of the pack, and took the lead when no one else could.

Not even upturned turf, fierce rain, or racers blocking the way could stop you. You simply weaved your way past each competitor, leaving them behind, one after the other.

And each time you passed another racer, your sky-blue eyes shone brilliantly, as if you yourself had become like the vast sky—soaring freely forward, always just out of reach...

"Mr. C.B. finishes in first place! Mr. C.B. takes it all here at the first race of the Triple Crown!"

In that whirlwind of rain and mud, when visibility was at its worst, you stood above everyone else.

And then like a child, you wiped the mud off your cheek with the back of your hand, before slowly curling the corners of your mouth into an easygoing smile. Turning to the crowd, you stood tall and raised your hand to the sky.

Seeing that pose, the fresh memories of my bitter defeat instantly faded away, replaced by your gallant figure etched into my mind.

Brand new racewear for me! ♪ A first-place winner I'll be!

"With my racewear, I'm so happy! Running, running, yay! ♪"

"Hop, skip! Skip, hop! ♪ I'll give it my all, like 'blaaam!'"

A girl from my class is singing something to herself. It's not the first time she's done this, but for some reason, I find myself especially curious about her song today.

"...What kind of song are you singing?"

I walk up to her and ask a simple question. She looks like she's having so much fun, and her energy is infectious.

"Oh, it's my racewear song! I'm really looking forward to wearing it at my next race! I'll give it my all, like 'blaaaam!'"

She's singing because she's excited. And she's excited because she's going to run. Her explanation is so simple, but it resonates with me deeply.

"Good for you."

At some point, I forgot what it felt like to run for fun.

"Hey, do you wanna sing with me? Here, I'll count us in!"

"Whoa, r-right now?"

"A one, and a two! Hop, skip! Skip, hop! I'll give it my all! ♪"

"L-like 'blaaaam...'"

"Like 'blaaam!' Hehe, I can't wait for my next race!"

It's funny, I've only sung a single line with her, but I already feel a bit happier.

Right, races are supposed to be fun. There's no need to worry about the details. I just need to go out there and have fun!

Wow... Ikuno, you look so pretty... Just like a real bride!

"Thank you, Rice."

Wearing such splendid racewear in front of everyone... is making me surprisingly self-conscious. Still, this kind of opportunity doesn't come by every day. I just need to make it through this photo shoot...

"What?! Ikuno, you're getting married?! No way, since when?! I don't want you to gooo!"

"Huh? What're you doing, Turbo?! Look, you're getting in the shot, silly!"

"Nooo waaaaay! Don't leave me behiiind!"

Due to Turbo's misunderstanding, the photo shoot has been rendered into a state of mild disarray. That said, hearing the star front runner Turbo cry "Don't leave me behind!" is amusing in it's own way.

"Turbo, please calm down. I'm not going anywhere."

There's no way I'd leave now. After all, we're still in the middle of a race of our own.

Once we're done taking photos, I think I'll join Turbo and the others in their training.

Once upon a time, I went to a wedding.

When the bride smiled gently, the people around her also started smiling, and everyone was as happy as they could be. I'll always treasure that wonderful memory.

One day, I want to make everyone smile like that. I want to spread happiness to everyone around me. It's not much, but that's my dream.

I'll gather up my courage... and take that big step forwards. And once I do, I'll see smiles everywhere I look.

It'll be just like what the bride saw at that wedding—the sight of happiness. Up until now, I've only gotten a glimpse of that view.

"...I want to keep on making people smile."

I hope to keep on putting smiles on everyone's faces, so that someday, everyone can find their very own happiness.

Dober's way too nice. She's always overthinking things and worrying about others.

Why do I know this? Because she's saved me so many times with her kindness and thoughtfulness!

"...Let the match begin!"

Entering the ring from the red corner, we have Tracen Academy's Phantom Bird—Masked El!

And in the blue corner, we have her opponent, Señorita Mejiro—Worrywart Dober!

The rules are simple! Listen to Dober, talk with her, and make her smile for a perfect ring out! ...Haha, I've got this one in the bag!

"After all, with this mask on, I'm pumped up, confident—invincible, even!"

In a picturesque forest, two Umamusume swing from a single vine, riding the wind.

"Um, Taiki?"

"What's up? Somethin' in your noggin?"

"There's something I've always wanted to try if I ever got into a situation like this... Well, more like say? Or even shout? Anyways, there's something!

"Roger that, Tannhauser! We're birds of a feather!"

"Right! Then, on three... One, two... three!

"Ahhhhh! ♪"

A water spirit's shoreline, a fairy's secret garden, and a door only revealed by starlight... After overcoming countless trials, the townspeople had finally reached their destination. And now, in front of them, was the most beautiful sight in the world...

"Well, I'll be! The walls are glowing baby blue!"

"It's like we've entered another world... Who knew a place like this existed?"

Faced with such a dreamlike scene, the townspeople could only open their mouths in awe and say...

"Ahhh, this is it! We've really entered the world of that story!"

To become the best racer in all of Japan.

That was my dream. It was my everything—what I'd promised to my moms.

Still, dreams are funny things, aren't they? I wanted to grab hold of mine, but like mist on a cold morning, no matter how hard I tried, I couldn't. All I could do was try my hardest—to keep on reaching for something that couldn't be reached.

But it was worth it.

All of my experiences—everyone I've met along the way—helped make my dreams come alive! I've had nail-biting races against my rivals, and I overcame hurdles inside of me that I thought I couldn't. There's been tough times, even sad times. But there's also been fun times and happy times. Everything I've been through has helped shape my dream!

Do you have a dream? Or maybe a burning desire? Then let's go chase it together! I'll help make your dreams come true!

If she wins this race, then both mother and daughter will have conquered the Japanese Oaks—an unheard-of feat. The venue is filled with both expectations and doubts, each weighing heavily on this one racer's shoulders.

But the moment the Empress takes to the turf, all the commotion is blown away in a burst of wind. For her, even the wind is but another of her subjects. She heads towards the starting gate with confident strides.

Her sharp eyes demand absolute fealty from all who face her. Her fingers clench into a fist so tight her nails dig into her skin.

She desires perfection. She hungers for victory. Her pride as Empress is her weapon.

"This race is mine for the taking."

Raise the level of your Support Cards\nto increase your Support Bonus!
The higher your Support Bonus, the higher the boost\napplied to your scores in Team Trials!
Increase your Support Bonus!\nSupport Points can also be obtained through Team Trials!
Your Support Bonus is getting up there!\nLet's keep the improvements coming!
Everyone's support has grown stronger, and you have more options for training!\nYou're killing two birds with one stone!
Amazing!\nYou're bound to get better scores in Team Trials. ♪
The support from everyone is immense!\nThis will greatly enhance your scores in Team Trials!
Your Support Bonus is at the max!\nCongratulations!
The higher your Support Bonus, the higher the boost\napplied to your scores in Team Trials!
Raising Support Card levels will increase your Support Bonus!
If your trainee can't run very fast during the final spurt,\nshe might be lacking Speed.
If your trainee often falls in rank near the end of the race,\nshe might be lacking Stamina.
If your trainee is having trouble getting to the front,\nyou might want to work on her Power.
If your trainee can't keep up during the final stretch,\nshe might be lacking Guts.
With high Wit, your trainee will find it easier to position herself\nand make use of skills.
You should enter in Daily Races if you want to acquire more monies or Support Points.
Strengthening your Support Cards and Umamusume are vital to winning races.
The outcome of a race can be affected by the weather, how the field runs,\nand at times even sheer luck.
Increasing the level of Support Cards makes their effects more powerful.
Uncapping Support Cards and leveling them up further\nwill unlock more powerful effects.
Mood Effect will also amplify the effects of negative moods, so be careful!
Friendship Bonus makes Friendship Training even more beneficial.
Speed Bonus and other attribute bonus effects make\ntheir relevant trainings more effective.
Training Effectiveness makes all training more effective,\nregardless of type.
Initial Speed and similar effects let you begin a Career\nplaythrough with higher attributes.
Initial Friendship Gauge comes in handy when\nyou want to build friendship earlier.
Race Bonus and Fan Bonus also apply to goal races.
Race Bonus helps you obtain more skill points.
Hint Levels increases the level of hints given to your trainee.
Hint Frequency makes hint events occur more often.
Specialty Priority helps a support character appear\nin their preferred training more often.
Event Recovery increases the amount of Energy gained from events.
Event Effectiveness increases the beneficial effects gained from events.
Failure Protection makes it harder to fail Training with that support character.
Energy Cost Reduction makes training consume less Energy\nwhen performed with that support character.
Wit Friendship Recovery increases the amount of Energy gained\nfrom Wit Friendship Training.
Friendship Training becomes available after a Friendship Gauge turns orange.
Friendship Training is even more effective when multiple instances trigger at once.
When you slot a Support Card in your deck, events associated\nwith that card will be more likely to occur.
Events of Support Cards not in your deck can still occur.
Keep in mind that you cannot use a Support Card\nof the Umamusume you are training.
You can trade in Support Cards you don't want for Cleats,\nwhich can be exchanged for items in the shop.
You can check what skill hints you can get from a Support Card in its "Career events" section.
You can increase the Potential level of a trainee\nwith monies and various items.
The higher an Umamusume's Potential level, the more skills\nshe gets at the start of a Career playthrough.
Items that increase Potential level can be obtained by placing 1st in\nG3 or higher races in Career.
Collecting enough Star Pieces of an Umamusume will allow you to perform Star Unlock.
Performing Star Unlock on an Umamusume will improve her attributes\nand increase the level of her Unique Skill.
Increasing an Umamusume to 3★ or higher will unlock her signature racewear.
You can trade in unneeded Star Pieces for Clovers,\nwhich can be exchanged for other items in the shop.
Veteran Umamusume can grant inspiration as Legacies\nand participate in Team Trials or other races.
Note that when you transfer a Veteran Umamusume, she cannot return.
The rating given at the end of a Career playthrough is calculated based on\nparameter totals and skills acquired.
Veteran Umamusume can obtain Sparks corresponding to what they\nlearned and accomplished during their careers.
Sparks have different rarities.\nThe more ★ a Spark has, the greater its effect.
The more a trainee accomplishes during her career,\nthe more Sparks she can get.
Some Sparks activate their effects during the Inspiration event\nat the start of a Career playthrough.
Attribute Sparks will improve your trainee's parameters when activated.
Aptitude Sparks will increase track, distance, and style aptitudes.
Skill Sparks will increase skill hint levels.
Race Sparks will increase parameters and skill hint levels.
When a Spark for a skill your trainee has already acquired activates, stats will increase instead.
Legacy Umamusume can continue to grant inspiration\nin as many Career playthroughs as you like.
Legacy Umamusume can be borrowed from friends using monies.
When selecting a Legacy Umamusume, their affinity with your trainee is shown by ◎＞○＞△, from highest to lowest.
Classmates, roommates, and family members will naturally\nhave a higher affinity with each other.
You get a discount when borrowing a Legacy Umamusume from a fellow Club member.
You might learn something by checking the Career info of your friends' Star Umamusume.
When Rushed, a runner panics and loses endurance.\nHigher Wit can help prevent this.
The better a runner is at navigation, the easier she can weave\nthrough rivals blocking her way.
Speed is particularly important for sprint races.
Speed and Power are crucial for mile races.
A good balance of attributes is critical for medium races.
Stamina and Guts are key for long races.
A runner's predicted performance is rated in the paddock\nwith ◎>○>▲>△ from highest to lowest.
Going out for some recreation can improve your trainee's Mood and recover Energy.
You might be able to cure a harmful condition by enjoying recreation\nat a shrine with your trainee.
I wonder if something might happen after the URA Finale if your bond\nwith Reporter Otonashi is strong enough...
It might be easier to receive inspiration from Legacies \nwho have strong affinity with your trainee.
Huh?! Support Card Events can also increase the hint levels of Rare Skills?!
Information related to Umamusume is displayed on the school\nbulletin board on the Home screen.
Sprint races are 1400m or shorter, and mile races are between 1401m and 1800m.
Medium races are between 1801m and 2400m long. Long races are over 2401m long.
Rain or snow can cause track conditions to worsen from Firm to Good, then Soft,\nand finally Heavy, making it harder to run.
Races are divided into levels. From lowest to highest,\nthese are: Pre-OP < OP < G3 < G2 < G1.
The higher the level classification of a race, the stronger the runners.
G1, G2, and G3 races are called graded races, with G1 being the highest rank.
A trainee can obtain a Spark for her Unique Skill if she is 3★ or higher.
Racecourses for the URA Finale are chosen based on your trainee's\nmost frequent race destinations during her career.
The Senior Spring Triple Crown refers to the following three races:\nthe Osaka Hai, Tenno Sho (Spring), and Takarazuka Kinen.
The Triple Tiara refers to the following three races:\nthe Oka Sho, Japanese Oaks, and Shuka Sho.
The Senior Autumn Triple Crown refers to the following three races:\nthe Tenno Sho (Autumn), Japan Cup, and Arima Kinen.
The Classic Triple Crown refers to the following three races:\nthe Satsuki Sho, Japanese Derby, and Kikuka Sho.
If you don't want to accidentally skip over unread events,\nyou can change the settings in your Options.
If you use Star Pieces, you can unlock new trainees\neven if you haven't scouted them.
Growth Rate makes it easier for a trainee to improve their attributes.
The higher the hint level of a skill, the less skill points you need to acquire it.
In races such as Team Trials and Room Matches, your opponents' skill activations will be visible as well. You can disable this feature in the Options menu if you prefer.
