Each Umamusume has different goals.\nThis is your goal for the time being!
These commands let you progress through the Career.
Executing a command consumes a turn.
These are the different types of Training!\nEach one increases different attributes.
Take note of the Failure Rate.
The lower your trainee's Energy, the higher the Failure Rate.
Failing a Training can lead to drops in attributes\nand Mood, so be careful!
When Energy is low, have your trainee rest to recover it.
Next, select a skill to learn. Use the skill points you obtained earlier!
You're all set! Time to enter a race!
The races you are able to participate in are shown in this list.
In the paddock, you can check the stats and\npopularity of the other runners.
Predictions of a runner's performance are denoted\nby the symbols [△] [▲] [○] [◎] from lowest to highest.
The higher a runner's ability and Mood, the higher her popularity and the expectations placed on her will be.
Of course, popularity doesn't guarantee a win,\nbut the more favored your trainee is, the more you can expect from her!
You can also change a runner's strategy in the paddock.
It's best to select a strategy that plays to a runner's strengths.
You're all set!\nIt's finally time to start the race!
Congratulations on making it through a Career!
Don't forget to use up your remaining skill points!
And with that, the Career playthrough is complete!
A trainee who has completed her Career will be evaluated based on set criteria\nand then registered as a veteran.
Good luck! Try to aim for the highest rank!
A trainee who has completed her Career can obtain Sparks.
If you select her as a Legacy Umamusume, you will be able to use her as Inspiration for another runner and pass on her Sparks!
Make sure you praise your trainee for all her hard work!
Usually, a winning concert is held after a race,\nbut since you're in the middle of practice, we'll skip it for now.
Although it was short this time,\na Career is usually three years long.
Please treasure the time you spend together with your trainees!
The top right symbols represent the expert predictions,\nwhile popularity is representative of fan opinion.

Every day is a busy day at Tracen Academy. 
Select a <color=#ff9900>Career scenario</color> and tackle the problems
happening around school.
Finishing a playthrough will help your trainees grow!

Work together with your Umamusume for three years in the <color=#ff9900>Twinkle Series</color> and <color=#ff9900>make their dreams come true</color>!\nEvery Umamusume has different goals.\nGuide your trainees and be the ideal trainer they need to achieve their dreams.

Each Umamusume is unique! They all have different attributes, skills, and aptitudes. You can train them as many times as you like, so <color=#ff9900>how about you start by selecting the one you're most interested in!</color>

<color=#ff9900>Inspire</color> your trainee with the legacies of veteran runners! <color=#ff9900>Sparks of Inspiration</color> can raise attributes and aptitudes at the start of a Career, as well as during it through <color=#ff9900>Inspiration events</color>. Veterans can pass on their legacy as many times as you like!

Let's <color=#ff9900>choose</color> Support Cards! You will receive <color=#ff9900>Support Card Effects</color>\nfrom the characters you select, and <color=#ff9900>Career events</color> corresponding to the cards are more likely to occur.\nPlease note that you cannot select the <color=#ff9900>character you're training</color> as a Support Card.
Support Cards have <color=#ff9900>types (Preferred Trainings).</color>\nThe effects gained when training together vary from card to card.

If you raise the Friendship Gauge of Support Cards during a Career, then <color=#ff9900>Friendship Training</color> will occur when you perform their Preferred Training.\nFriendship Training will improve your trainee more than usual!

Use <color=#ff9900>upgrade items</color> to increase the <color=#ff9900>Potential</color> level of your trainees, unlocking new skills for them to learn during Career playthroughs. Upgrade items can be obtained through Career playthroughs and Daily Races.

Use an Umamusume's <color=#ff9900>Star Pieces</color> to unlock her hidden talents. Performing a <color=#ff9900>Star Unlock</color> will raise her base attributes. At 3★, Umamusume acquire their signature racewear.

Use <color=#ff9900>Support Points</color> and <color=#ff9900>monies</color> to level up your Support Cards, unlocking powerful new effects and strengthening existing ones. Upgrade items can be obtained through Career playthroughs and Daily Races.
Use <color=#ff9900>duplicates</color> of Support Cards you already own to <color=#ff9900>uncap</color> them, increasing their maximum level.

You can trade in duplicate Support Cards for <color=#ff9900>Cleats</color>.\nCleats are valuable items and can be exchanged for other items in the shop. The first time you receive a Support Card, it will be stored in the Support Card List.\nIf you receive the same card again, it will be put in your Support Card Storage and can be converted.

Once you complete an Umamusume's Career, she will be decorated as a <color=#ff9900>Veteran Umamusume.</color>\nOnce decorated, she can participate in the Team Trials and other races, as well as inspire trainees in future Career playthroughs!\nNote that once transferred, a Veteran Umamusume cannot return.

Umamusume Star Pieces can be converted into <color=#ff9900>Clovers</color>.\nClovers are very valuable and can be exchanged for items in the shop.\nThey can also be used to unlock new trainees or Star Unlock existing ones, so think carefully before converting them.
Lead Team Sirius and advance the <color=#ff9900>Main Story</color>!\nYou will be rewarded for progressing through the story.

Encountering Umamusume and raising your <color=#ff9900>Bond Level</color> will let you progress through their <color=#ff9900>Umamusume Story!</color>\nBond Points can be increased by completing Career playthroughs and racing in Team Trials. \nYou will be rewarded for progressing through the story.

Form a <color=#ff9900>team</color> of Veteran Umamusume and compete against <color=#ff9900>teams</color> from all over the world. You will move up in <color=#ff9900>Class</color> according to how well you do! Once a week, you will be rewarded according to the Class you're in.
Achieve excellent race results and record your <color=#ff9900>high score</color>.\nEvery week, the Class you're in will change based on your High Score.

In Team Trials, <color=#ff9900>five races with different conditions</color> are held at a time.\nAs your Class increases, the number of Umamusume that can participate per race will increase, up to a maximum of fifteen.\nForm a powerful team and challenge the Team Trials!

Build a team of <color=#ff9900>Veteran Umamusume</color> to compete in five races over different distances and surfaces. Be sure to choose runners with the right aptitudes for the job. The score your team <color=#ff9900>ace</color> earns for each race will increase by 1.1x.
If you form a team of strong Veteran Umamusume, your <color=#ff9900>Team Rating</color> and <color=#ff9900>Team Rank</color> will increase.\nYou can also obtain rewards as your Team Rank rises.

In Team Trials, you will play against <color=#ff9900>opponents with a similar Team Rating to you</color>.\nThe more you win against Teams with a high Team Rating, the easier it will be to obtain a higher Score.\nForm a strong team and conquer the Team Trials!

Take on a Legend Race with your Veteran Umamusume.\nThe better you place, the more rewards you will get. Tickets required to participate will replenish daily at 3 p.m. (UTC) during the availability period and when the Legend Umamusume changes.

Take on Daily Races with your Veteran Umamusume.\nVarious rewards will be up for grabs depending on which races you participate in.\nYour tickets will be <color=#ff9900>fully replenished</color> every day.
<color=#ff9900>Join Clubs</color> with trainers from all over the world.\nYou can interact with other members and help each other train.
Members can give each other <color=#ff9900>various items</color>.\nMembers can also borrow each other's <color=#ff9900>Star Umamusume</color> for Legacy usage at a discount.

You can watch live performances of <color=#ff9900>songs</color> you have acquired.
Choose your favorite combination of main and backup dancers from among your Umamusume and outfits.
If an Umamusume is marked as a <color=#ff9900>Singer</color>, you can also hear her voice.
Songs can be acquired through the Main Story and Career.

You can check and set your trainer info.\nYou can get <color=#ff9900>birthday wishes</color> from Umamusume on the Home screen, and experience slightly different lines in scenarios depending on your <color=#ff9900>gender</color>.\n(Gender can be changed at any time.)

Choose a <color=#ff9900>Star Umamusume</color> and <color=#ff9900>Career Support</color> to help out your fellow trainers. Every time a follower borrows them, <color=#ff9900>Friend Points</color> will be sent to your Presents the following day.
Earn titles through <color=#ff9900>Title missions</color> and <color=#ff9900>events</color>. You can change your title at any time.

Help make the director's dream come true!\nYou can obtain <color=#ff9900>trophies and rewards</color> by winning graded and Legend races.\nIn addition, you will be rewarded for completing trophy-collection missions.

You can now select the Star Umamusume and Career Support of other trainers you <color=#ff9900>follow</color>. Helping out a <color=#ff9900>mutual follower</color> will earn you more Friend Points. If you're looking for friends to follow, check out the <color=#ff9900>Recommended</color> tab.

Collect records related to Umamusume to increase the <color=#ff9900>Umamusume Archive level</color>.\nYou can accumulate Archive experience by viewing stories and obtaining rating records.\nIncreasing the Archive level also earns you rewards.

Try to get Umamusume plushies (also known as Cuties)!\nYou will be successful if you can get one within <color=#ff9900>three</color> attempts.\nSucceeding may result in your trainee unlocking <color=#ff9900>new hints!</color>
Congratulations on your promotion to <color=#ff9900>Class 2</color>! You can now enter a <color=#ff9900>second</color> runner in each type of race.
Congratulations on your promotion to <color=#ff9900>Class 3</color>! You can now add a third runner to your team for each race.
In Career, the aim is to perform well in your trainee's <color=#ff9900>goal races</color>!\nTo do this, you'll need to <color=#ff9900>train</color> and raise her <color=#ff9900>attributes</color>!

Learning <color=#ff9900>skills</color> will give your trainee all sorts of bonuses during races. The <color=#ff9900>skill points</color> needed to learn them can be obtained from races and some events.

If your trainee is running low on <color=#ff9900>Energy</color> or in a bad <color=#ff9900>Mood</color>, she won't be able to perform her best in training and races. Remember to be kind to your trainee by letting her <color=#ff9900>rest</color> to recover Energy and go out for <color=#ff9900>recreation</color> to improve her Mood.

Umamusume may sometimes acquire <color=#ff9900>conditions</color> that negatively affect their training or how they are feeling.\nYou have a chance of curing these conditions by going to the <color=#ff9900>Infirmary</color>, so make sure to do so as soon as possible.
You can execute various commands while training!\nExecute them in a well-balanced manner to guide your trainee to fame!

From the second half of June in her junior year, you can enter your trainee in <color=#ff9900>races</color>. Train well and aim for <color=#ff9900>first place!</color>\nDepending on how she places, your trainee can obtain <color=#ff9900>skill points</color> and <color=#ff9900>fans</color>, which are required to participate in big races.\nYou can also obtain random items based on how she placed and how big a lead she had.

Umamusume race for the first time in a <color=#ff9900>Make Debut</color>. If they finish first, they will be able to run in various races.\nIf they fail to finish first, try for a win in a <color=#ff9900>maiden race</color> from your next turn instead!

<color=#ff9900>Attributes</color> such as Speed and Stamina gained through training are tied to <color=#ff9900>various aspects of performance in races</color>.\nThe <color=#ff9900>distance</color> of the race and an Umamusume's <color=#ff9900>running style</color> also affect which aspects are most important, so you will need to create a <color=#ff9900>training regimen</color> that suits each runner!

The <color=#ff9900>track surface</color> and <color=#ff9900>distance</color> differ depending on the race.\nAn Umamusume's proficiency in a specific race depends on her <color=#ff9900>Track and Distance Aptitudes</color>.\nTry to <color=#ff9900>win races that have a ★ next to them</color> in the race list!

Races are divided into five levels: <color=#ff9900>Pre-Open, Open, G3, G2, and G1</color>.\nTo work your way up to winning at the highest level in the Twinkle Series, G1 races, start with <color=#ff9900>Pre-Open or Open!</color>

By expending <color=#ff9900>Energy</color> to perform <color=#ff9900>training</color>, your trainee can improve her <color=#ff9900>attributes</color>. Training <color=#ff9900>Wit</color> will instead <color=#ff9900>recover</color> Energy and also yield more <color=#ff9900>skill points</color> than other types of training.

Training with an Umamusume from your <color=#ff9900>Support Card</color> deck will lead to increased <color=#ff9900>training efficiency</color> and an increase in their <color=#ff9900>Friendship Gauge</color>. Once an Umamusume's Friendship Gauge becomes full enough, they'll start to trigger <color=#ff9900>Friendship Training</color>. Non-Umamusume characters in your Support Card deck may sometimes watch your training sessions too, which can lead to various benefits.

When you see a <color=#ff9900>[!]</color> attached to a Support Card's character in training,\nit means you have a chance at obtaining a <color=#ff9900>skill hint</color> upon successful completion of the training.\nWhen a skill's hint level is increased, <color=#ff9900>the skill points required to obtain the skill will be discounted</color>.

If you train while your trainee has <color=#ff9900>low energy</color>, she may <color=#ff9900>fail</color> her training and not improve her abilities.\nFailure in Training has <color=#ff9900>various drawbacks</color>, so always keep an eye on your trainee's <color=#ff9900>Energy</color> and the <color=#ff9900>Failure Rate!</color>

By spending <color=#ff9900>skill points</color>, you can teach your trainee <color=#ff9900>skills</color> which will activate during races. Some skills only activate if your trainee is using a particular <color=#ff9900>strategy</color> or racing over a certain <color=#ff9900>distance</color>, so make sure to pick skills that suit her style and distance <color=#ff9900>aptitudes</color>.

Your trainee may gain <color=#ff9900>skill hint levels</color> from various <color=#ff9900>events</color>, including Support Card and Trainee Umamusume events. They can learn skills at a <color=#ff9900>skill point discount</color> based on their skill hint level for that skill, so be sure to use Support Cards that have the skills you're looking for.

There are three main types of skills:
-<color=#ff9900>Unique Skills</color>: Special skills that Umamusume start with.
-<color=#ff9900>Rare Skills</color>: Powerful skills gained through hints from limited sources.
-<color=#ff9900>Normal Skills</color>: Skills gained through hints from a variety of sources.
In addition, there are also skills that can only be acquired through <color=#ff9900>inheritance of certain Sparks</color>.

When you raise your Support Cards to a certain level, they will contribute to your <color=#ff9900>Support Bonus,</color> which <color=#ff9900>increases your team's score in Team Trials.</color>\nTry and increase the level of as many Support Cards as you can!
You can view <color=#ff9900>exclusive stories</color> unlocked through events.

The Team Triathlon is coming to Tracen Academy! It was a complicated decision for everyone to make, but Kitasan Black, Mejiro Bright, and Narita Top Road have each decided to join. Now they must search for members, practice as a team, and overcome the many obstacles that are sure to come. Which team will cross the finish line and be crowned victorious?
<color=#ff9900>Train Umamusume</color> during events to obtain <color=#ff9900>Event Points</color>!\nCollect a lot of points to obtain various <color=#ff9900>rewards</color>.

By collecting Event Points, you can advance through the <color=#ff9900>Event-Exclusive Story</color>.\nAdvancing through the story and completing the Event Missions will earn you <color=#ff9900>event-exclusive Support Cards</color>,\nas well as other rewards including <color=#ff9900>Rainbow Crystal Shards</color> and <color=#ff9900>event-exclusive titles</color>.

When <color=#ff9900>Event Bonus Trainee Umamusume</color> and <color=#ff9900>Event Bonus Support Cards</color> are in your collection, you get <color=#ff9900>bonus event points</color> at the end of Career playthroughs.

You will receive <color=#ff9900>Event Points</color> and <color=#ff9900>Prize Coins</color> for completing Event Missions.\nYou can also get Prize Coins from the event's <color=#ff9900>Daily Missions</color>.

You can use <color=#ff9900>Prize Coins</color> to play the <color=#ff9900>Prize Derby</color>. Get a <color=#ff9900>bingo</color> to win <color=#ff9900>event-exclusive Support Cards</color>, <color=#ff9900>Gold Crystal Shards</color>, and more.

<color=#ff9900>Train Umamusume</color> and complete <color=#ff9900>Event Missions</color> during events to obtain <color=#ff9900>Prize Coins</color>.\nYou can enter the <color=#ff9900>Prize Derby</color> by collecting <color=#ff9900>Prize Coins</color>.
You can win <color=#ff9900>Prize Derby rewards</color> depending on how you place in the Prize Derby.\nWhen you win a reward for the first time, you will have a chance to get bingo!

The squares on the board are filled in when Prize Rewards are obtained.\nWhen three adjacent squares are filled vertically, horizontally, or diagonally, <color=#ff9900>one line is completed</color>, and you will receive the <color=#ff9900>bingo reward</color> corresponding to the number of completed lines.\nWhen you have completed <color=#ff9900>eight lines</color>, you can exchange for a whole new bingo sheet.

Run as a team in the <color=#ff9900>Unity Cup</color>, which is held after the late June and late December turns end.\nIf you win, your <color=#ff9900>Team Ranking</color> will increase, and your <color=#ff9900>trainee and team members</color> will <color=#ff9900>grow stronger</color>.\nWin more races in the <color=#ff9900>Unity Cup</color> to strengthen your trainee!

Form your team and shoot to win the Unity Cup! Races are held for each division, and the team <color=#ff9900>with the most wins out of the five races will be crowned the winners.</color>\n<color=#ff9900>Team Ranking increases with each victory.</color> The higher your opponents' ranking, the bigger the increase.
By using Star Pieces, you can <color=#ff9900>unlock</color> Umamusume.\nOnce you unlock an Umamusume, you can start training her.
Register three Umamusume and <color=#ff9900>match with trainers from all over the world</color> to compete in real-time races!\nTrain strong Umamusume and win against trainers just like you!

Choose between the <color=#ff9900>Open League</color> and <color=#ff9900>Graded League</color> as suits your play style. The two leagues have different limits on the <color=#ff9900>Career Rank</color> of runners you can enter.

In a <color=#ff9900>Room Match</color>, you can enter your runners in races with other trainers.
 - <color=#ff9900>Host</color>: Create your own race with custom conditions.
 - <color=#ff9900>Join</color>: Participate in another trainer's race.
 - <color=#ff9900>Spectate</color>: Enter a Race ID to spectate.

You can hold your own G1 races. When you hold a race, you can choose from two modes.
-<color=#ff9900>Simple Mode</color>: This mode allows you to hold a race immediately.
-<color=#ff9900>Advanced Mode</color>: This mode allows you to set things such as the race's weather and participation requirements.
<color=#ff9900>Up to three Umamusume</color> per person can be registered to run in the race.

Each league takes place over  <color=#ff9900>three rounds</color>. Starting from round two, trainers will split into groups A and B based on their race results. Advance to the <color=#ff9900>finals</color> and win it all!

You can recruit participants for the races you hold from the Signed up Races list.
You can also use <color=#ff9900>Club Share</color>, <color=#ff9900>Social Media Share</color>, or recruit nearby Trainers by having them enter your <color=#ff9900>Race ID</color>.
You can also <color=#ff9900>save</color> races, so you can look back on your favorite races.
We highly recommend holding races with your friends.
Transfer Requests allow you to <color=#ff9900>transfer Veteran Umamusume to other teams in exchange for rewards</color>. Note that when you transfer a Veteran Umamusume, she cannot return.

The <color=#ff9901>rewards vary</color> depending on the requirements of the team asking for the transfer.\nIn addition, each request has a rank, and <color=#ff9901>the higher the rank, the better the rewards that can be obtained for fulfilling it</color>.
Some requests with high demands even offer <color=#ff9901>Star Pieces</color> as rewards.

When a special icon appears on a team member, you can activate <color=#ff9900>Unity Training</color> by training with them.\nWhen activated, <color=#ff9900>the attributes of that team member will increase.</color>\nMake good use of this to improve your team in order to win the Unity Cup!

Furthermore, if you participate in Unity Training with <color=#ff9900>two or more team members</color>, it'll <color=#ff9900>increase</color> the training's effects!\nAlso, <color=#ff9900>the more team members</color> participate in the special training, <color=#ff9900>the greater the attributes and skill points gained</color> from the training will be!\nHowever, keep in mind that the <color=#ff9900>Energy consumed will also be greater.</color>

A team member who has performed Unity Training many times may experience a <color=#ff9900>Spirit Burst</color>!\nWhen this occurs, that team member's <color=#ff9900>attributes will increase greatly</color> and <color=#ff9900>your trainee will also grow and receive skill hints!</color>\nYou should aim to frequently activate <color=#ff9900>Spirit Bursts</color>!

You can check the items you have here. You can also use consumables. Some items can be converted into monies.\n<color=#ff9900>Items that have been converted cannot be restored to their original state,</color>\nso be careful when converting.

As team members improve, your <color=#ff9900>Team Power</color> increases and you will receive gifts from Tazuna.\nAdditionally, as the team's attributes increase, so too will <color=#ff9900>training levels.</color> Since Team Power affects <color=#ff9900>how strong your trainee can become</color>, you should train your team members as much as you can!

Your <color=#ff9900>team title</color> represents an overall evaluation of your team's <color=#ff9900>ranking</color> and <color=#ff9900>Team Power</color>. The more prestigious your team title, the more your trainee will grow at the end of the playthrough. Forge your team's legend in the Unity Cup!

The Uma Jukebox lets you <color=#ff9900>change the background music</color> to any song you've unlocked. Select the jukebox from the menu on the right side of the screen to play songs anywhere you like, whether it's the Home screen, a Career scenario, or any other part of the game.
Become a star in the Twinkle Series!
"Even if the whole world turns against us..." This part always makes my heart skip a beat. ♪ It's perfect for a princess and her prince!
"Music is the bean paste to the bun of your heart." I want to know what flavors you like!
The life of a racer is full of ups and downs, smiles and frowns... so we squeezed all the big, wacky adventures of Tracen life into one itty-bitty song! ♪
What lies beyond the goal? What unique scenery is there to see there? This song blends wonder and warmth, gently encouraging you to keep on running.

This song is about the dreams we have, and the resolve it takes to keep running toward them. It's about moving forward, even when you're lost or scared. If you ever lose your way, we're here to tell you, "Go this way."

This one's the story of two Umamusume. Out in the freezing rain, they huddled together and made a promise—"It's not over yet—we still can shine, if our dreams are on the line and you're by my side..."
We all start in the same gates. The path opens to any who would run it—so go! Surge ahead, with the tailwind urging you on!
Bakushin! Bakushiiin! BAKUSHIIIIIIN! This song was written by Bakushin for Bakushin, and I hope it will inspire some BAKUSHIIIN in you too!\n—Comment from Class Representative
Our first anniversary... We really poured all our gratitude into this song. It's about reaching our dreams, and finding new inspirations beyond them. We'll keep running with you, further and further!
This song shines with all that makes youth so dazzling—friendship, rivalry, tears, smiles, doubt, and hope.
Don't stop till you're a top Umadol! All you need to sing this song are a mic, a splash of cuteness, and an infectious smile! ☆
Dreams come to those who run on! An ode to the radiance of youth and all the tears and smiles it brings.
Look! Is it a ship?! Is it a UFO?! No, it's Golshi! Peace, peace! ♪ How'd you like that? No one's safe from the Golshi takeover! ☆
A stately choral piece befitting of the prestigious Mejiro family. The glory of the Mejiro name knows no bounds—not now, not ever.
BGM for the StarHorse TV news program. If you hear this song start playing, it's time to find out what's new with StarHorse4!
You can't have a StarHorse allowance race without this fusion tune. An homage to the evolution of the series.
If this song plays during your debut, you know you're in for a show! Getting this song to play is a goal for any StarHorse4 player.
BGM that plays during breeding in StarHorse4. Craft your ideal pedigree at your leisure with this relaxed tune.
BGM that plays during breeding in StarHorse4. The music seems to grow along with your horse and pairs well with the cutscenes.
Too much content—can't watch it all!
Top Gun: Maverick\nMovie out May 27, 2022 in the United States and Japan
Too much content—can't watch it all!
Too much content—can't watch it all!

It's better like this now that Golshi looks bigger, don'tcha think?!
The Mejiro family is holding an afternoon party!
The 3rd EVENT "WINNING DREAM STAGE"\nBlu-ray on sale from Jun 15, 2022!\nIncludes all the singing from Day 1 & Day 2!
The "WINNING LIVE 07" CD on sale from Aug 17, 2022!\nIncludes songs from the game and exclusive solos!\nThe Mejiro family sings "The Mejiro Anthem"!

The name's Nakayama Festa. I need a lot more than a lukewarm race to thrill me, get it? It's gotta be something hotter—hot enough to burn!
Tsurumaru Tsuyoshi here! I've always dreamed of winning the Triple Crown, and now I'm going all out to—cough, cough! I-I'm all right, just choked on air. Really, never felt better!
...Oh? Is it time for self-introductions already? Teehee! My name is Mejiro Bright, and I will strive to live up to the Mejiro family name.
Hi, I'm Narita Top Road! I'm so thankful to all the people rooting for me. I'll do everything I can to make them proud!

Increase velocity with pretty princess power when engaged in a challenge on the final straight.
When passing another racer at the front part of the pack on the final corner or later, perform a dazzling display that greatly increases velocity for a moderate duration.
Control breathing and kick forward hard toward victory in the second half of the race after recovering endurance with skills at least 3 times.
If positioned toward the front with 200m remaining, increase velocity. Then, if also positioned near the leading Umamusume, gather strength to move slightly forward.

Heh, now this is the good stuff! Light, soft, and chewy! Heh, nobody grills squid quite like Kansai does. I swear, people here in the East just throw the whole squid on the grill and call it done, y'know what I mean? But this is how it's supposed to be done. I loved 'em when I was little, y'know. Used to eat it all the time growin' up! ...Whaddya mean, I'm still little?! ...Yeesh, if that's how you're gonna be, maybe I won't share any. Hehe, aw, I'm just kiddin'. I'm a bigger person than that. Here! Now... how do ya like it? I toldja it was the good stuff!

White or black. Heads or tails. Win or lose. The gates flip open like the toss of a coin. Everything's up in the air—until someone crosses the finish. Or at least, it should be. But the big races aren't so simple. People've just gotta play favorites and make a fuss over who's gonna win. You really think the favorite's gonna win just 'cause she knows how to do a little fan service? What a joke. Races wouldn't be any fun if you knew the winner before it even started. Once the die's cast, the rest'll be up to Lady Luck. Those racers are going all-in for just a two-minute shot at glory—no guarantees. And that's what makes races exciting. Now... you'd better watch those gates. The fanfare'll start any second now.

In Practice mode, you can set up races with <color=#ff9900>any conditions of your choosing</color>. You can enter not only your own Veteran Umamusume, but also <color=#ff9900>those of other trainers</color>. You can practice with up to 18 runners at once.
You can race with Umamusume you've seen in Team Trials and Room Matches by registering them as <color=#ff9900>practice partners</color>. The Star Umamusume of friends you follow can join in too.

You can <color=#ff9900>share</color> your favorite <color=#ff9900>Veteran Umamusume</color> with your Club and on social media. Save lots of practice partners with your clubmates and friends to make the most out of practice races!

When starting a Career playthrough, you can choose to activate the <color=#ff9900>Event Boost</color> feature by spending twice the usual TP cost. If you do, the number of <color=#ff9900>Event Points</color> and <color=#ff9900>Prize Coins</color> earned at the end of the playthrough will be doubled.

You can <color=#ff9900>uncap</color> a Support Card using <color=#ff9900>a copy of the same card</color>. Uncapping raises the maximum level of the card, allowing you to further enhance it. SR and SSR Support Cards can also be uncapped by using <color=#ff9900>Uncap Crystals</color>.
In Showtime Mode, <color=#ff9900>opponents</color> are harder at higher difficulty levels. Reach a <color=#ff9900>good ending</color> in a playthrough to unlock the next difficulty.
Train Umamusume with the <color=#ff9900>right aptitude for the race type</color> and fulfill the selected <color=#ff9900>score bonus</color> requirements to get the highest score possible.
During the <color=#ff9900>Trainer Aptitude Test</color> event, you can view <color=#ff9900>rankings of the Support Cards</color> most frequently used in each test!

There are no character-specific goals in this Career scenario. Instead, every Umamusume must pursue the <color=#ff9900>common goal</color> of <color=#ff9900>gaining Result Points</color>. Try to hit the required number of Result Points in each of the junior, classic, and senior years! You can choose for yourself which races to enter over the course of the playthrough, but you'll earn more points for more challenging races and better results!
<color=#ff9900>Reach every Career goal</color> to take on the <color=#ff9900>Twinkle Star Climax</color>. Beat the competition over three races and become the Twinkle Top Star!

Place well in races to get <color=#ff9900>shop coins</color> in addition to Result Points. Exchange your shop coins at the Pro Shop for training items, which can be used for a variety of useful things such as <color=#ff9900>raising attributes</color>, <color=#ff9900>restoring Energy</color>, and temporarily <color=#ff9900>boosting stats gained from training</color>!

Every year <color=#ff9900>at the end of the the Late December turn</color>, an award is given to the <color=#ff9900>highest performing Umamusume</color> in each year. Make sure to deepen your relationship with supporters, achieve good results in races, and increase your number of fans! Winning this award will give your trainee big benefits, including increasing the level of her Unique Skill!

<color=#ff9900>Win against rivals</color> during Career playthroughs to <color=#ff9900>raise attributes</color> and <color=#ff9900>get skill hints</color>. Defeat the most capable opponents and train your Umamusume to the next level!

Place high in each of the three races of the Twinkle Star Climax to earn <color=#ff9900>Victory Points</color>. The runner with the <color=#ff9900>highest total points</color> wins, so work together with your Umamusume and aim for the top!

In Practice mode, you can set up races with <color=#ff9900>any conditions of your choosing</color>. You can enter not only your own Veteran Umamusume, but also <color=#ff9900>those of other trainers</color>. You can practice with up to 18 runners at once.
You can race again with Umamusume you've seen in Team Trials and Room Matches by saving them as <color=#ff9900>practice partners</color>. The Star Umamusume of friends you follow can join in too.

You can <color=#ff9900>share</color> your favorite <color=#ff9900>Veteran Umamusume</color> with your Club and on social media. Share and save lots of practice partners with your clubmates and friends to make the most out of practice races!

If there are Umamusume you want to practice with multiple times, you can save them to a <color=#ff9900>My Runners list</color> to <color=#ff9900>easily sign them up again</color>. You can even save them from the results screen after a practice race. Be careful when removing a practice partner, though—this will also remove them from any lists you have included them in.

If there are Umamusume you want to practice with multiple times, you can save them to a <color=#ff9900>My Runners list</color> to <color=#ff9900>easily sign them up again</color>. You can even save them from the results screen after a practice race. Be careful when removing a practice partner, though—this will also remove them from any lists you have included them in.

For each available test, you can view a ranking of the <color=#ff9900>top 100 highest scores</color> achieved by all trainers! <color=#ff9900>Veteran Umamusume in the top 30</color> can be <color=#ff9900>borrowed as guest Legacies an unlimited number of times</color> in applicable Career scenarios!

You can earn <color=#ff9900>Test Coins</color> by completing tests. Earn even more coins by achieving <color=#ff9900>score bonuses</color>, <color=#ff9900>high ratings</color>, and completing <color=#ff9900>missions</color>!

<color=#ff9900>Certain items</color> can raise the <color=#ff9900>Hint Level</color> of an Umamusume's skill. Raising a skill's base Hint Level lets you start a Career playthrough with the level <color=#ff9900>already raised</color>. Give it a try!
<color=#ff9900>Get more points</color> in the Racing Carnival by using lots of skills and achieving great results.

Each time you enter a Carnival Race, it will fill the <color=#ff9900>Challenge Gauge</color>. Fill this gauge completely to start a <color=#ff9900>Challenge Race</color>, but be prepared—it will be <color=#ff9900>Very Hard</color> or even <color=#ff9900>Extreme</color> difficulty!
Use <color=#ff9900>Carnival points</color> from Carnival races at the shop to <color=#ff9900>get tons of useful items</color>!
The Daily Legend Races are a great place to test your skill—and get Star Pieces for the Legend Umamusume. Entry tickets are <color=#ff9900>fully replenished</color> each day.

You've got your very own <color=#ff9900>Trainer Card</color>, which can be used to share your accomplishments on <color=#ff9900>social media</color>. You can also <color=#ff9900>customize</color> it with a picture of your favorite Umamusume, Support Card, or in-game photo.
You can toggle whether to display your Star Umamusume's <color=#ff9900>Spark Sheet</color> on your Trainer Card. Export it for <color=#ff9900>social media</color> to show off your best racer!
Use the in-game <color=#ff9900>Photo Camera</color> to snap pics in <color=#ff9900>races, winning concerts, and the story</color>. You can also edit shots with a variety of filters!
Photos you take are saved in the <color=#ff9900>Photo Album</color>, where you can view them at any time. You can also put a photo on your <color=#ff9900>Trainer Card</color>.

Place well in races to get <color=#ff9900>shop coins</color> in addition to Result Points. Exchange your shop coins at the Pro Shop for training items, which can be used for a variety of useful things such as <color=#ff9900>raising attributes</color>, <color=#ff9900>restoring Energy</color>, and temporarily <color=#ff9900>boosting stats gained from training</color>!

On a first Career playthrough with an Umamusume, the <color=#ff9900>best scenario</color> to get to know them better is <color=#ff9900>"The Beginning! URA Finale!"</color> Be the best trainer you can be as you experience the challenges of fulfilling your Umamusume's goals. Grow together, and go for the top of the URA Finale!

This scenario features many unique Career events that <color=#ff9900>can't be seen anywhere else</color>! Discover new sides of your favorite Umamusume through glimpses into their everyday lives, or just enjoy the ups and downs of the passing seasons together!

In the <color=#ff9900>All Together! Top Umadol Project</color> event, rewards for everyone are unlocked based on the total number of fans collected by all players in Career mode. Individual rewards are unlocked based on how many fans you personally collected.

<color=#ff9900>Golshi Mode</color> makes <color=#ff9900>opposing racers</color> tougher in Career races. Finish a Career playthrough in Golshi Mode to gain bonus rewards based on how successful the playthrough was.
Community Rewards are unlocked based on <color=#ff9900>the combined number of fans collected by all trainers during the event</color>. The higher the total gets, the better the rewards!

In a <color=#ff9900>Room Match</color>, you can enter your runners in races with other trainers.
 - <color=#ff9900>Host</color>: Create your own race with custom conditions.
 - <color=#ff9900>Join</color>: Participate in another trainer's race.
 - <color=#ff9900>Spectate</color>: Enter a Race ID to spectate.

You can hold your own G1 races. When you hold a race, you can choose from two modes.
-<color=#ff9900>Simple Mode</color>: This mode allows you to hold a race immediately.
-<color=#ff9900>Advanced Mode</color>: This mode allows you to set things such as the race's weather and participation requirements.
<color=#ff9900>Up to three Umamusume</color> per person can be registered to run in the race.

You can recruit participants for the races you hold from the Signed up Races list.
You can also use <color=#ff9900>Club Share</color>, <color=#ff9900>Social Media Share</color>, or recruit nearby Trainers by having them enter your <color=#ff9900>Race ID</color>.
You can also <color=#ff9900>save</color> races, so you can look back on your favorite races.
We highly recommend holding races with your friends.

If there are Umamusume you use frequently in Room Matches, you can register them to a <color=#ff9900>team slot</color> to <color=#ff9900>easily sign them up again</color>. You can even register them from the results screen after a Room Match race.

If there are Umamusume you use frequently in Room Matches, you can register them to a <color=#ff9900>team slot</color> to <color=#ff9900>easily sign them up again</color>. You can even register them from the results screen after a Room Match race.

You can change the outfits of Umamusume you've scouted! Aside from certain scenes that override outfit selection, the individual settings for <color=#ff9900>each Umamusume</color> apply throughout the game—even for <color=#ff9900>Veteran Umamusume</color>.

You can choose to add an Event Boost on the confirmation screen before starting a Career playthrough. With the boost enabled, the playthrough costs <color=#ff9900>twice the TP</color> and yields <color=#ff9900>twice the Show Gauge</color> results as a regular run.
<color=#ff9901>StarHorse4 Special Transfers</color> allow you to transfer Veteran Umamusume to other teams in exchange for rewards. Note that when you transfer a Veteran Umamusume, she cannot return.

The teams requesting transfers have <color=#ff9901>ranks</color> based on their requirements. The higher the rank, the better the rewards that can be obtained for fulfilling the request. There's even a <color=#ff9901>certain trainer</color> with a <color=#ff9901>rank of 4</color>...

Rank 3 requests offer <color=#ff9901>the transferred Veteran Umamusume's Star Pieces</color> as a reward. Requests that are level 3 or higher also offer <color=#ff9901>Star Fruit</color>, a new item for <color=#ff9901>StarHorse4</color> Special Transfers.

<color=#ff9900>Scout Races</color> are entered in teams of seven. The captain position is reserved for your Veteran Umamusume, while the other six slots are filled through <color=#ff9900>scouting</color>. Keep racing and scouting to make your team the best it can be!

The number of <color=#ff9900>Scout Race Tickets</color> is replenished to 5 each day at 22:00 (UTC), but they can also be replenished faster with items and daily missions. The <color=#ff9900>race conditions</color> change <color=#ff9900>every 3 races</color>. The upcoming race conditions can be checked from the Upcoming Race screen.

<color=#ff9900>Scout Points</color> are obtained from Scout Races. The amount earned changes based on race result, the opposing team's rank, and bonuses. Assemble a full team and tackle various race conditions to claim victory.

In <color=#ff9900>Scout Time</color>, you can <color=#ff9900>scout</color> Umamusume from the opposing team and swap them for members of your own team. The amount of <color=#ff9900>Scout Points</color> needed varies based on the Umamusume's rank.
Improve your team's stats to raise the <color=#ff9900>Team Rank</color>. Both raising the rank and completing <color=#ff9900>special missions</color> will earn you rewards.

When you <color=#ff9900>win</color> a <color=#ff9900>Scout Race</color>, the captain and members of your team are added to your record and a bonus is applied to the team's performance and Scout Points earned. Winning races with certain combinations of Umamusume in your team also earns <color=#ff9900>team skills</color>.

Darley Arabian is the embodiment of courage. She was created in the virtual world by AI that adopted the name of the Three Goddesses, the predecessors to all Umamusume. Although she is free and uninhibited, she is always level-headed. She wishes for nothing more than the well-being of all Umamusume-kind.

Godolphin Barb is the embodiment of love. She was created in the virtual world by AI that adopted the name of the Three Goddesses, the predecessors to all Umamusume. She treasures all of creation and watches over it with kindness. Although at times she tests racers to their limits, she does so out of affection.

Byerley Turk is the embodiment of discipline. She was created in the virtual world by AI that adopted the name of the Three Goddesses, the predecessors to all Umamusume. Despite her commanding nature, her strictness comes from a good place. She believes that the way to carve out the future is through physical strength.
